bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, October 27, 1928

div1.p: Carter anticipates completing her work at the same time that Frost completes his work.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, October 27, 1928
div1.opener:
Book, Misel
Report (weekly)
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
October 27, 1928.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
Miss Brown and I have put in another very satisfactory week:
working at the Library of the Surgeon General, the Library of Congress
and at my apartment at night. We are working again this evening and
to-morrow (Sunday) in order to get some material ready for Dr. Frost
in advance of his needing it.

In reply to your inquiry, in your letter of September 20th., I
would say that I think I can clean up, or close up, my work about the
same time that Dr. Frost finishes his. Working, as I now am, in con-
junction with Dr. Frost, I, of course, expect to keep up my work
until his is completed, which event may reasonably be expected to occur
in about one more month. This, according to my last advices from him
(October 25, 1928). It will, as you say, indeed be “a great satis-
faction and a great relief” when the work is finished: And this not only
to me but to all of you who have been interested in, and sympathized
with, the doing, from Father's first tentative notes up to the present
time.
div1.closer:
With best wishes, I remain
Very truly yours, Laura A. Carter Dr. Frederick F. Russell, Director,
International Health Division
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
